alert.note: Alert for Brooks; Coastal Cameron; Coastal Kenedy; Coastal Willacy; Inland Cameron; Inland Kenedy; Inland Willacy; Jim Hogg; Northern Hidalgo; Southern Hidalgo; Starr; Zapata (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued March 23 at 9:47PM CDT until March 24 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...Critical Fire Weather Danger Thursday... .Very low humidity is forecast Thursday with an extremely dry air mass expected over Deep South Texas. Much of the region will see the relative humidity plummet below 15 percent with 20-foot winds increasing between 10 to 20 mph with some gusts as high as 35 mph. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM TO 8 PM CDT THURSDAY FOR VERY LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY, ELEVATED WINDS AND ABUNDANT CURED FUELS FOR ALL OF DEEP SOUTH TEXAS... * AFFECTED AREAS...Zapata, Jim Hogg, Brooks, Inland Kenedy, Coastal Kenedy, Starr, Southern Hidalgo, Northern Hidalgo, Inland Willacy, Coastal Willacy, Inland Cameron, and Coastal Cameron Counties. * TIMING...10 AM CDT to 8 PM CDT. * WIND...20-foot Northwest winds 10 to 20 MPH, gusts as high as 35 mph. * HUMIDITY...Between 8 to 20 percent for all of Deep South Texas except 15 to 25 percent for Coastal Cameron, Willacy and Kenedy counties. * IMPACTS...any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means critical fire weather conditions are occurring now...or will shortly. In general...these conditions include sustained 20 foot winds of 25 MPH or greater...humidity ranging from below 25 percent in Zapata County to below 45 percent along the coast...each lasting for 2 hours or longer... and cured fuels. Humidity below 25 percent in most areas will trigger fire danger at lower wind speeds. Detailed decision tables are found at HTTP://WEATHER.GOV/RGV/?N=MAPCOLORS#FIRE.
